intro: Cheilanthes paucijuga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows on rocky substrates, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The plant has a compact, cushion-like growth form with short, narrow leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its rhizomes are thick and fleshy, allowing it to store water and nutrients efficiently. Cheilanthes paucijuga is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
